front.div:
Abstract:
This deliverable explores several research lines for the single-user cooperative transmission containing:
One-way or two-way relays, full or imperfect CSI, multiple relays, full-duplex or half-duplex relays, extended
Gaussian function, turbo-coded relay transmission, multilayer cooperative DF, management of ARQ and
design of optimal decoders.
The different areas under study have been classified in three groups: resource allocation, physical layer
design and MAC functionalities. It has been shown that an optimal resource allocation can be derived for
various schemes (precoder optimization with one-way relays, multiple-relay and two-way relay channel).
Likewise, a network dimensioning tool based on indifference plots will give insights of the benefits of different
transmission schemes. On the other hand, some aspects like how the turbo-code relay is implemented, new
transmission schemes or the derivation of optimal decoders are tackled in the physical layer design section.
This work elucidates two options for adopting the ARQ protocols by the cooperative transmissions: only-
source manages the procedure or source and relay control the ARQ. An analysis in terms of outage capacity
is carried out.
